holidays.name: Clean Up Your Room Day
holidays.description: A playful nudge to tackle the chaos and mess lurking in your personal space, making cleaning a bit more fun and rewarding.
holidays.origin: Unknown origin but popularized by parental reminders and self-improvement advocates as a mid-May motivational boost.

holidays.name: Lucky Penny Day
holidays.description: Celebrate the charm and superstition tied to finding a lucky penny! On this day, everyone looks down at the ground hoping to spot a shiny 1-cent coin bringing good fortune.
holidays.origin: Rooted in old folk traditions where finding a penny was considered auspicious; May 10 was chosen to spread a little luck around.
holidays.funFact: The phrase 'Find a penny, pick it up, and all day long you'll have good luck' dates back hundreds of years.

holidays.name: Ballpoint Pen Day
holidays.description: Honoring the invention of the ballpoint pen, the handy writing tool that revolutionized note-taking and doodling everywhere!
holidays.origin: Commemorates the 1945 patent of the modern ballpoint pen by Laszlo Biro, a Hungarian-Argentine inventor.

holidays.name: Mother's Day (UK & Ireland)
holidays.description: Though celebrated globally on various dates, in the UK and Ireland Mother's Day (or Mothering Sunday) often falls on this day in early May, honoring mothers everywhere.
